body:

mlflow.utils.process.ShellCommandException: Non-zero exitcode: 1

However my local install of prophet works. Not sure whether it is  an issue  of installing prophet via conda as I had indicated earlier. If so what is the workaround,  solution?

conda.yaml in example has python  version 3.6. When I changed it to  version 3.8 it worked fine. What I am struggling  with now is  how to provide arguments  to prophet model served from mlflow using json for prediction. Any pointers will  be helpful. I am trying  something like:

curl http://127.0.0.1:5000/invocations -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"columns": ["ds"], "data" :[("2021-10-26 10:05:30")]}'

curl http://127.0.0.1:5000/invocations -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"columns": ["ds"], "data" :[["2021-10-26 10:05:30"]]}'

did the trick
